channel.title: The system could not find the path specified?
channel.description: I read the frequently asked questions and did what it says but it still says the same thing......can some1 help me

item.title: The system could not find the path specified?
item.dc:creator: @ghfgh ghfgh
item.description:
@ghfgh wrote:

click here stop spamming… and if it still says cannot find path go to my computer-system information(on left)-advanced-enviroment variables and click new and type in top CLASSPATH and for bottom box put CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;. chane the jdk1.5.0_09 to ur version now make another called PATH and in bottom put C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\binchange the jdk to ur version

item.source: The system could not find the path specified?

item.title: The system could not find the path specified?
item.dc:creator: @hippyss hippyss
item.description:
@hippyss wrote:

Let me guess it’s your compiler? and runserver? if so just replace the old jdk version or use this compiler content

@echo off color 0a title Yourservername here "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" -d ./ ./src/*.java attrib +H *.class<—compiler

@echo off color 0a title Yourservername here java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server<—runserver

Hope this helps

Read full topic
